title: Forest of la Coubre
text:
The Forest of la Coubre () is a large forest in the region of <a href="Nouvelle-Aquitaine">Nouvelle-Aquitaine</a>, near the city of <a href="Royan">Royan</a>. Its area is roughly 7916 hectares, making it the third largest "<a href="National%20Forest%20%28France%29">forêt domaniale</a>" (French State's inalienable domaine) of the north of the region, behind forest of la Double and the forest d'Horte.
Around its remaining perimeter, it contains or is adjacent to numerous communes including <a href="La%20Tremblade">La Tremblade</a>, <a href="Les%20Mathes">Les Mathes</a>, <a href="Arvert">Arvert</a>, <a href="%C3%89taules%2C%20Charente-Maritime">Étaules</a>, <a href="Saint-Augustin%2C%20Charente-Maritime">Saint-Augustin</a> and <a href="Saint-Palais-sur-Mer">Saint-Palais-sur-Mer</a>. It borders the <a href="atlantic%20ocean">atlantic ocean</a>, the <a href="Gironde%20estuary">Gironde estuary</a> and the <a href="forest%20of%20the%20Combots%20d%27Ansoine">forest of the Combots d'Ansoine</a>. The forest of la Coubre is composed mostly of <a href="maritime%20pine">maritime pine</a>. This pine plantation was started in the 19th century by Médéric de Vasselot de Régné in the Pointe de la Coubre area, to halt erosion.
The <a href="EuroVelo">EuroVelo</a> bicycle route (Atlantic Coast route) cross the forest.
